segment.source: Applications can be complex, and providing effective help for your users can greatly improve their experience.
segment.target: Applications can be complex, and providing effective help for your users can greatly improve their experience.

segment.source: Not all applications need to provide help for their users, and the type of help provided can vary greatly, depending on the application and how people will use it.
segment.target: Not all applications need to provide help for their users, and the type of help provided can vary greatly, depending on the application and how people will use it.

segment.source: If you decide to provide help, consider the guidelines outlined here.
segment.target: If you decide to provide help, consider the guidelines outlined here.

segment.source: And remember, help that isn't helpful can be worse than no help at all.
segment.target: And remember, help that isn't helpful can be worse than no help at all.

segment.source: Intuitive design
segment.target: Intuitive design

segment.source: As useful as help content can be, your app cannot rely on it to provide a good experience for the user.
segment.target: As useful as help content can be, your app cannot rely on it to provide a good experience for the user.

segment.source: If someone is unable to immediately discover and use the critical functions of your app, that person won't use your app.
segment.target: If someone is unable to immediately discover and use the critical functions of your app, that person won't use your app.

segment.source: No help content will change that first impression.
segment.target: No help content will change that first impression.

segment.source: An intuitive and user-friendly design is the first step to writing useful help.
segment.target: An intuitive and user-friendly design is the first step to writing useful help.

segment.source: Not only does it keep the user engaged long enough for them to use more advanced features, but it also provides them with the knowledge of an app's core functions, which they can build upon as they continue on.
segment.target: Not only does it keep the user engaged long enough for them to use more advanced features, but it also provides them with the knowledge of an app's core functions, which they can build upon as they continue on.

segment.source: General instructions
segment.target: General instructions

segment.source: A user will not look for help content unless they already have a problem, so help needs to provide a quick and effective answer to that problem.
segment.target: A user will not look for help content unless they already have a problem, so help needs to provide a quick and effective answer to that problem.

segment.source: If help is not immediately useful, or if help is too complicated, then people are more likely to ignore it.
segment.target: If help is not immediately useful, or if help is too complicated, then people are more likely to ignore it.

segment.source: All help, no matter what kind, should follow these basic principles:
segment.target: All help, no matter what kind, should follow these basic principles:

segment.source: Easy to understand: Help that confuses the user is worse than no help at all.
segment.target: Easy to understand: Help that confuses the user is worse than no help at all.

segment.source: Straightforward: Users looking for help want clear answers presented directly to them.
segment.target: Straightforward: Users looking for help want clear answers presented directly to them.

segment.source: Relevant: Users do not want to have to search for their specific issue.
segment.target: Relevant: Users do not want to have to search for their specific issue.

segment.source: They want the most relevant help presented first (this is called "contextual help"), or they want an easily navigated interface.
segment.target: They want the most relevant help presented first (this is called "contextual help"), or they want an easily navigated interface.

segment.source: Direct: When a user looks for help, they want to see help.
segment.target: Direct: When a user looks for help, they want to see help.

segment.source: If your app includes pages for reporting bugs, giving feedback, viewing term of service, or similar functions, they should be included as links or footnotes on the main help page, and not as items of importance.
segment.target: If your app includes pages for reporting bugs, giving feedback, viewing term of service, or similar functions, they should be included as links or footnotes on the main help page, and not as items of importance.

segment.source: Consistent: No matter the type, help is still a part of your app, and should be treated as any other part of the UI.
segment.target: Consistent: No matter the type, help is still a part of your app, and should be treated as any other part of the UI.

segment.source: The same design principles of usability, accessibility, and style that are used throughout the rest of your app should also be present in the help you offer.
segment.target: The same design principles of usability, accessibility, and style that are used throughout the rest of your app should also be present in the help you offer.

segment.source: Types of help
segment.target: Types of help

segment.source: There are three primary categories of help content, each with varying strengths and suitable for different purposes.
segment.target: There are three primary categories of help content, each with varying strengths and suitable for different purposes.

segment.source: You can use any combination of them in your app, depending on your needs.
segment.target: You can use any combination of them in your app, depending on your needs.

segment.source: Instructional UI
segment.target: Instructional UI

segment.source: Ideally, users should be able to use all the core functions of your app without instruction, but occasionally your app may depend on the use of a specific gesture, or there may be secondary features of your app that are not immediately obvious.
segment.target: Ideally, users should be able to use all the core functions of your app without instruction, but occasionally your app may depend on the use of a specific gesture, or there may be secondary features of your app that are not immediately obvious.

segment.source: In these cases, instructional UI should be used to educate users with directions on how to perform specific tasks.
segment.target: In these cases, instructional UI should be used to educate users with directions on how to perform specific tasks.

segment.source: See guidelines for instructional UI
segment.target: See guidelines for instructional UI

segment.source: In-app help
segment.target: In-app help

segment.source: The standard method of presenting help is to display it within the application at the user's request.
segment.target: The standard method of presenting help is to display it within the application at the user's request.

segment.source: There are several ways in which this can be implemented, such as help pages or informative descriptions.
segment.target: There are several ways in which this can be implemented, such as help pages or informative descriptions.

segment.source: This method is ideal for general-purpose help that directly answers a user's questions without complexity.
segment.target: This method is ideal for general-purpose help that directly answers a user's questions without complexity.

segment.source: External help
segment.target: External help

segment.source: For detailed tutorials, advanced functions, or libraries of help topics too large to fit within your application, links to external web pages are ideal.
segment.target: For detailed tutorials, advanced functions, or libraries of help topics too large to fit within your application, links to external web pages are ideal.

segment.source: These links should be used sparingly if possible, as they remove the user from the application experience.
segment.target: These links should be used sparingly if possible, as they remove the user from the application experience.
